text: Tore A. Liltved (8 May 1939 – 13 July 2004) was a Norwegian politician for the Conservative Party. He was born in Arendal. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from Aust-Agder in 1989, and was re-elected on one occasion. He had previously served in the position of deputy representative during the terms 1977-1981, 1981-1985 and 1985-1989\. From 1981 to 1986 he filled in for Astrid Gjertsen, who was appointed to the Willoch cabinet. He was a member of Moland municipality council from 1971 to 1981, serving as mayor in 1979-1981\. ==References== * Category:1939 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Conservative Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Tore A. Liltved
